demographic_info.religion: I do not identify with any religious group or faith

survey_responses.What do you think your life might be lik: I imagine my life much faster than the one I currently live, not by my own decision, but because everything will be much more automated and there will be no short, transitory actions on a day-to-day basis.
survey_responses.What is another dangerous outcome you ca: I imagine lack of privacy as a big source of problems. Private personal information being used in an unseemly way just to feed algorithms. People taking extra precautions so that their faces don't end up in an image-generating database, with all the danger that this entails.
survey_responses.What is another positive outcome you can: Another positive outcome would be free access to more specific information, especially considering that currently search engines like Google or Bing have greatly lowered their quality and accuracy of search results. Now, what would have to happen for that to happen? There would have to be an effort to feed AI databases with unbiased information.
survey_responses.Describe a concrete scenario where you w: in drafting laws and government programs. I am aware of the human bias in decision making at a country/global level, and that many times people get caught up in that instead of moving forward at a more productive speed, but I think that human progress should not be conditioned to the same production standards of a company. Progress is about moving forward by making mistakes and fixing them along the way.
survey_responses.Explain what makes one of these scenario: Future D sounds more promising. Any monopolistic company with the seal of approval from the US government sounds like imminent danger to me.

future f sounds better. despite considering myself someone who is very much against censorship, the epidemic of loneliness mixed with the popularity of AIs is something never seen before, so I would approve a restriction on the use of these in that context. in fact I think there is an episode of Futurama that explains this problem
survey_responses.What is ONE specific ethical or moral pr: the idea of moving forward, of experiencing life despite adversity with a spirit that can be broken but never completely shattered
survey_responses.What is one ethical or moral principle,: respect, since freedom of expression is often confused with the freedom to say any nonsense
survey_responses.What do you consider your culture? What: For me, culture is what I share with the people around me: language, climate, history, idiosyncrasies, etc. I honestly don't know what I like most about it, but it does make me feel less alone in the world, in some way...
survey_responses.What is one unique perspective that your: I would say resilience. My country has been through a lot in its little more than 200 years of existence, but there is something about its spirit that remains with the years: the ability to get back up despite adversity.
survey_responses.What kinds of cultural things would you: the homogenization of culture, making us all look alike
survey_responses.What is the biggest problem in your life: find a good job that also fills the spirit
survey_responses.What would you consider giving your life: to the expression of the arts, creating and writing stories that can bring emotions to people
survey_responses.What is something unique, that other peo: that there are no billionaires or people with too much power, nobody needs to own so much
survey_responses.What are you most scared will be true in: that those who are most helpless lose any opportunity to grow in life, that it becomes meaningless to live
survey_responses.If you could make world leaders understa: that once they are dead they will have no power or money
